title: Business Development Lead
content:
The Opportunity
We are looking for a highly talented Business Development Lead to help accelerate business growth across New Zealand and expand our current client base. This role will report directly to the Managing Director, APAC with additional support of the wider growth team across APAC. 
 
About the Role
The Business Development Lead is responsible for creating net new opportunities using a multi-channel growth approach. The primary measurement of success for this role is defined by achieving growth targets as set forth by the Chief Growth Officer as well as one’s ability to out-pitch, out-position, out-play and out-procure the competition. 
 
Responsibilities Include

Lead, manage and drive the team to develop and execute sales strategies to profitably grow revenues and expand the account base in target markets.
Coach, and mentor senior Growth Directors & Managers, with a hands-on, team-oriented approach.
Drive effective, accurate, and timely forecasting and pipeline reporting.
Team with marketing, pre-sales, partner management and professional services to maximize opportunities and foster cohesive sales strategies.
Pipeline development and customer acquisition activities, including direct sales, co-selling with growth team leadership, managing directors, marketing teams, partnership leads and partner growth leads.
Identifying areas of new opportunities within current client relationships (white space) under the guidance of client leads.
Designing strategies with Regional Head of Clients and market leadership to expand within client relationships.
Build executive level relationships for new prospects and with present clients.
Work closely with S4 cross functional teams on prospective deals to ensure accurate bids, compelling value propositions and a frictionless deal environment.
Identify, develop and prospect cold leads.

Preferred Experience & Qualifications

Preferred years of experience: 10 years of full cycle sales experience; demonstrated career progression and strong performance as a senior leader, ideally in digital content, platform sales or related business. A minimum of 5 years leading a sales or partnership development organization.
Proven track record of successfully negotiating deals at senior levels of major brands; ideally brings deep relationships from the media and agency landscape.
Experience working alongside producers, creatives & engineers. 
Knowledge of technology; well-developed product sensibility and experience leading creative discussions regarding potentially innovative, unique and engaging context and product offerings
Track-record of collaboration and influencing across a large organization to deliver to expectations.
Management of a team across countries in a client-facing environment.
Proven ability to use measurement and analytics to position performance data to illustrate impact.
As an ideal candidate, you should have demonstrated success in a measured and commission driven compensation model, with a history of achieving lead conversation and revenue targets.  
Strong business development skills with experience prospecting and bringing in new business
Proven ability to cultivate and maintain strong relationships with C level and Executive decision makers at the enterprise businesses/organisations
Ability to build and deliver exceptional presentations to your customers
Develop strategic and tactical account planning/execution and implement client strategy.
Foster and develop key relationships. Act as the primary contact for campaign performance and review, troubleshooting, client training, new products and policy, and implementation questions.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Strong presentation skills both remote and in-person
Ability to articulate and educate Clients and team members on Digital strategy, trends, challenges.

 
Traits

Competitive - you want to win and you effectively solve obstacles in the way of your goals.
Organized - you use and create systems to stay on top of your responsibilities.
Closer - you know how to seal the deal and get people over the finish line! 
You are passionate and a have a deep, holistic knowledge and passion for creative, technology and digital 
Skilled at working with cross-functional teams to successfully execute new product initiatives and develop partnerships.
Thrives in fast-paced environment, and can embrace rapid change and innovation  
Willing to travel as necessary

#LI-CX1About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering this question is entirely voluntary. Your response will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
